titles.title: A bill to provide for the rehabilitation of historic structures within the Sandy Hook Unit of Gateway National Recreation Area in the State of New Jersey, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1414)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 103-15.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 29.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-54.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 24.

action.text: Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 410 - 0 (Roll no. 137).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 2/4/1993--Introduced. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to enter into an agreement with the Monmouth County Vocational School District to permit the use by the District of specified properties for the purpose of developing and operating, without cost to the National Park Service (NPS), a secondary school program to be known as the Marine Academy of Science and Technology. Sets forth provisions with respect to: (1) reversion of properties that are not used by the District for a secondary school program; (2) rehabilitation of other property for park uses; and (3) reimbursement of expenses. Requires the Director to collect and retain reasonable fees for services provided to the District by NPS.
